definition: to bestow (a reward)/to give (to an inferior)/to hand down/a reward (bestowed by a superior)/to appreciate (beauty)

sentences.english: I won't stop helping people who are in meed .
sentences.chinese: 我不想停止幫助那些已經獲得獎賞的人們。

sentences.english: Not surprisingly, these neurons respond to primitive rewards, such as food and water.
sentences.chinese: 不出意料，這些神經元對食物和水等原始的獎賞反應。

sentences.english: All they want is a reward, and they want it now.
sentences.chinese: 所有它們想要的就是一個眼前獎賞，他們現在就要。
他們反而因爲等待獲得獎賞。

sentences.english: But the reward system is only means of Mathias.
sentences.chinese: 獎賞制度不過是恩威並施的手段而已。

sentences.english: The school rewarded him with a prize for excellence in his studies.
sentences.chinese: 他因學習成績優秀而受到學校的獎賞。

sentences.english: Completes loyalty club transactions including enrollments and reward redemptions with speed and accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 能快捷地及準確地爲客人提供會員登記和換領獎賞。

sentences.english: You gave me hyacinths first a year ago;
sentences.chinese: 一年前你把風信子初次給我作爲獎賞。

sentences.english: Rewards, more public pressure, inspiration, whatever it takes.
sentences.chinese: 獎賞，更多的公衆壓力，鼓舞，不惜代價。

sentences.english: I'm prepared to give you a lot.
They will receive rewards for getting out fast.
sentences.chinese: 他們撤得快就可以得到獎賞。

sentences.english: If he is petty and does not reward his men well, his men would not give their best.
sentences.chinese: 不獎賞士卒，士卒就不會在戰鬥中拼效力。

sentences.english: In our society, children are rewarded for good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 在我們的社會，規規矩矩的孩子要受到獎賞。

sentences.english: Poets are rewarded as well in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 在天堂也應該得到獎賞。

sentences.english: A high score can lead to various awards.
sentences.chinese: 高分數者可以獲得各種獎賞。

sentences.english: The king, hearing this, rewarded the tailor richly.
sentences.chinese: 聽到這個，國王重重獎賞了裁縫師。

definition: to obtain (sth) in exchange/to exchange (sth) for (sth else)
variant of 給予|给予[ji3 yu3]
to offer respectfully/to consecrate/to dedicate/to devote
to make a profit/to earn a packet
